beta-amyrin and alpha-amyrin were reported to possess anti-inflammatory. -23 and analgesic-25 properties triterpene beta-amyrin, showed antifungal activity againsta rabiei with an mic value of 0.0156 mg/ml, while alpha-amyrin, was proposed as a possible biomarker for the fungal resistance of grape-vine leaves (vitis vinifera).

beta-amyrin cinnamate was reported to inhibit the tpas-induced inflammation (id500.27 mol/ear;ci 95% 0.23-0.33 mol/ear) which is more inhibitory than the positive control, indomethacin (id50 0.91 mol/ ear ;ci 95% 0.23-0.33 mol/ear). alpha-amyrin cinnamate , lupeol cinnamate and beta-amyrin cinnamate, exhibited marked anti-inflammatory activity against tpa-induced inflammation (id50 = 0.15-0.75 mol/ear).
beta-sitosterol can inhibit the expression of npc1l1 in the enterocytes to reduce intestinal cholesterol uptake.
beta-sitosterol was also reported to attenuate beta-catenin and pcna expression, as well as quench radical in-vitro, making beta-sitosterol a potential anticancer drug for colon carcinogenesis.
beta-sitosterol was observed to have growth inhibitory effects on human breast mcf-7 and mdamb-231 adenocarcinoma cells.
beta-sitosterol was reported to induce apoptosis mediated by the activation of erk and the downregulation of akt in mca-t102 murine fibrosarcoma cells.
beta-sitosterol was shown to be effective for the treatment of benign prostatic hyperplasia.

chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extracts of hoya cumingiana decne yielded lupeol, beta-sitosterol, alpha-amyrin, beta-amyrin, stigmasterol, and bauerenol from the leaves; and taraxerol, from the stems.

hoya br is considered the largest genus of flowering plants in the family apocynaceae.
hoya meliflua is cultivated as an ornamental plant in the philippines.
hoya meliflua is interesting to note that although most hoya plants have no known biological activity and medicinal property, the compounds isolated from hoya meliflua possess diverse bioactivities.

in another study, the dichloromethane extracts of hoya paziae kloppenb yielded alpha-amyrin acetate, beta-amyrin acetate, taraxerol, and taraxeryl acetate from the stems and lupeol, alpha-amyrin, beta-amyrin, lupeol fatty acid esters vincent, et al.: triterpenes and sterols pharmacognosy journal, vol 11, issue 1, jan-feb, 2019 49 , alpha-amyrin fatty acid esters and beta-amyrin fatty acid esters from the leaves.
in another study, we reported the isolation of lupeol, alpha-amyrin , beta-amyrin , lupeol acetate , alpha-amyrin acetate triterpenes and sterols from leaves of hoya meliflua merr..
in the philippines, there are at least 109 species of hoya; 88 of these are endemic to the country.

in this study, the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of hoya meliflua yielded squalene, beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin , lupeol , oleanone , ursenone , lupenone , beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate , lupenyl cinnamate , beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol (figure 1).
isolation of chemical constituents of the leaves the air-dried leaves (252.8 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for three days and then filtered.

lupenone also increased the tyrosinase enzyme expression via mitogen-activated protein kinase phosphorylated extracellular signal regulated kinases 1 and 2 phosphorylation inhibition which results to stimulation of melanogenesis.
lupenone inhibited adipocyte differentiation by suppressing ppar and c/ebpalpha protein levels.
lupeol also showed antifungal activity against fusarium oxysporum and penicillium notatum.

lupeol exhibited potent anti-inflammatory activity in an allergic airway inflammation model by a significant reduction in eosinophils infiltration and in th2-associated cytokines levels that trigger the immune responses in asthma.
lupeol prevented the formation of vesical calculi and reduced the size of the preformed stones in rats.

of the twelve compounds isolated from hoya meliflua, lupeol is found in eight species, squalene, beta-amyrin and alpha-amyrin in five species, lupenone and beta-amyrin cinnamate in four species, alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in three species.
oleanone and ursenone are reported for the first time from philippine hoya species.
oleanone is interesting to note that although most hoya plants have no known biological activity and medicinal property, the compounds isolated from hoya meliflua possess diverse bioactivities.
one of the endemic species is hoya meliflua often confused with hoya diversifolia, which can also be found in other countries.

one such endemic species is hoya meliflua merr found in apayao, bataan, laguna, la union and rizal in luzon island and in leyte, mindoro, negros, palawan and panay islands in central philippines all at low altitudes.

recently, wereported the isolation of beta-sitosterol, stigmasterol, and taraxerol, from the stems and lupenone, beta-sitosterol, stigmasterol, 2-hydroxyethylbenzoate and fatty acid methyl esters from the leaves of hoya pubicalyx.

results: chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio. .: the results of our study indicate that hoya meliflua shares similar chemical characteristics with other members of the genus hoya.
sample collection hoya meliflua leaves and stems were collected from healthy vines of a clone that has been cultivated for more than 10 years.
samples labeled as pnri-h.ca were provided under material transfer agreement no. -004 dated june 24, 2016.

see discussions, stats, and author profiles for this publication at: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/330218492 triterpenes and sterols from leaves of hoya meliflua merr articleinpharmacognosy journal january 2019 doi: 10.5530/pj. .

silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio.
squalene showed cardioprotective effect which is related to inhibition of lipid accumulation by its hypolipidemic properties and/or its antioxidant properties.
squalene was reported to significantly suppress colonic acf formation and crypt multiplicity which strengthened the hypothesis that it possesses chemopreventive activity against colon carcinogenesis.
states that hoya meliflua is an unresolved name because some data suggest that it is synonymous with hoya diversifolia blume which is also found in other countries.

stigmasterol lowered plasma cholesterol levels, inhibited intestinal cholesterol and plant sterol absorption and suppressed hepatic cholesterol and classic bile acid synthesis in winstar as well as wky rats.
stigmasterol showed therapeutic efficacy against ehrlich ascites carcinoma bearing mice while conferring protection against cancer induced altered physiological conditions.

the 10% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed (3 ) using 1% etoac in petroleum ether to yield a mixture of beta-amyrin cinnamate, alpha-amyrin cinnamate, and lupenyl cinnamate, (5.0 mg), after washing with petroleum ether.

the 20% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed (3 ) using 2.5% etoac in petroleum ether to yield a mixture of oleanone, ursenone, and lupenone, (10.3 mg), after washing with petroleum ether.

the 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed (4 ) using 7.5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford a mixture of beta-amyrin, alpha-amyrin, and lupeol, (10.6 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the 40% acetone in ch2cl2 fractions was rechromatographed (3 ) using 10% etoac in petroleum ether to yield a mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol (21.0 mg) after washing with petroleum ether..
the ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed (2 ) using petroleum ether to afford squalene (12.8 mg).

the filtrate was concentrated under vacuum to afford a crude extract (7.8 g) which was chromatographed by gradient elution with ch2cl2, followed by increasing amounts of acetone at 10% increment by volume as eluents.
the mixture of beta-amyrin, and alpha-amyrin, effectively reduced the elevated plasma glucose levels during the oral glucose tolerance test (ogtt).
the most common constituents of the eleven native hoya species studied are beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol which are found in ten species.

the nmr spectra of beta-amyrin, are in accordance with data reported in the literature for beta-amyrin, alpha-amyrin, for alpha-amyrin, lupeol, for lupeol, oleanone, for oleanone, ursenone, for ursenone, lupenone, for lupenone, beta-amyrin cinnamate, for beta-amyrin cinnamate, alpha-amyrin cinnamate, for alpha-amyrin cinnamate, lupenyl cinnamate, for lupeol cinnamate, squalene, beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol.

the ratio of about 0.5:0.3:1 for the mixture of beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate was deduced from the intensities and integrations of the 1h nmr resonances for the olefinic protons of beta-amyrin cinnamate, 5.18 (brs),6,17 alpha-amyrin cinnamate, at 5.13 (brs);6,17 and lupenyl cinnamate, at 4.68 (br s) and 4.56 (br s).

the ratio of about 1:1:0.25 for the mixture of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol was deduced from the intensities and integrations of the 1h nmr resonances for the olefinic protons of beta-amyrin, at 5.16 (brs),7,12 alpha-amyrin, at 5.11 (brs)7,12 and lupeol, at 4.68 (brs) and 4.56 (brs). ,12,18 the ratio of about 1:1:0.30 for the mixture of oleanone , ursenone and lupenone was deduced from the intensities and integrations of the 1h nmr resonances for the olefinic protons of oleanone, at 5.19 (t, j = 3. hz),15 ursenone, at 5.14 (t, j = 3. hz)15 and lupenone, at 4.67 (brs) and 4.55 (brs).

the ratio of about 5:1 for the mixture of beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol was deduced from the intensities and integrations of the 1h nmr resonances for olefinic protons at 5.33 (brs, h-5) and methyl protons at 0.66 (s) for beta-sitoterol and olefinic protons at 5.33 (brs, h-5), 5.13 (dd, j = 8.4, 15.

the results of our study indicate that hoya meliflua shares similar chemical characteristics with other members of the genus hoya: hoya multiflora, hoya diversifolia, hoya cumingiana, and hoya paziae which yielded beta-amyrin and alpha-amyrin ; hoya mindorensis, hoya multiflora, hoya diversifolia, hoya cumingiana, hoya paziae, hoya cagayanensis, and hoya madulidii which contained lupeol ; hoya mindorensis, hoya pubicalyx, and hoya cagayanensis which afforded lupenone ; hoya wayetii, hoya buotii, and hoya madulidii which yielded beta-amyrin cinnamate ; hoya buotii, and hoya madulidii which afforded alpha-amyrin cinnamate ; hoya diversifolia and hoya madulidii which provided lupenyl cinnamate ; hoya mindorensis, hoya multiflora, hoya wayetii, hoya buotii, hoya diversifolia, hoya cumingiana, hoya pubicalyx, hoya cagayanensis, and hoya madulidii which contained beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol; and hoya mindorensis, hoya buotii, hoya diversifolia and hoya madulidii which contained squalene.
the structures of these compounds were identified by comparison of their nmr data with those reported in the literature.
the triterpenes and sterols obtained from hoya meliflua were also identified from other hoya species.
